name: CheckBackupStatus
description:
Get the current status of a backup creation process.

Use this tool to manually check the status of a backup creation process by its ID on the specified backend. Ideal for when waiting for completion is disabled or not suitable.

parameters.name: backup_backend_system
parameters.description: Specifies the backend storage system where the backup resides, such as 'filesystem', 'gcs', 's3', or 'azure'.

value_schema.description: Specifies the backend storage system where the backup resides (e.g., `filesystem`, `gcs`, `s3`, `azure`).

parameters.name: backup_identifier
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the backup. Use only lowercase, numbers, underscores, and minus characters.

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the backup. Must be URL-safe and compatible with filesystem paths (only lowercase, numbers, underscore, minus characters allowed).

parameters.name: bucket_name
parameters.description: Specifies the bucket, container, or volume name if required by the backend.

value_schema.description: Optional: Specifies the bucket, container, or volume name if required by the backend.

parameters.name: backup_storage_path
parameters.description: Specifies the path within the bucket/container/volume if the backup is not at the root. Optional.

value_schema.description: Optional: Specifies the path within the bucket/container/volume if the backup is not at the root.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the weaviate API.

parameters.name: bucket
parameters.description: Optional: Specifies the bucket, container, or volume name if required by the backend.

value_schema.description: Optional: Specifies the bucket, container, or volume name if required by the backend.

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Optional: Specifies the path within the bucket/container/volume if the backup is not at the root.

value_schema.description: Optional: Specifies the path within the bucket/container/volume if the backup is not at the root.

parameters.name: backend
parameters.description: Specifies the backend storage system where the backup resides (e.g., `filesystem`, `gcs`, `s3`, `azure`).

value_schema.description: Specifies the backend storage system where the backup resides (e.g., `filesystem`, `gcs`, `s3`, `azure`).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the backup. Must be URL-safe and compatible with filesystem paths (only lowercase, numbers, underscore, minus characters allowed).

value_schema.description: The unique identifier of the backup. Must be URL-safe and compatible with filesystem paths (only lowercase, numbers, underscore, minus characters allowed).
